snippet: The lawsuit, involving nearly $1 million, was the first to challenge New York City’s application of rules to defray costs of closing streets during athletic events.
abstract: Justice Margaret A Chan of State Supreme Court in Manhattan rules that nonprofit bicycling group Bike New York does not have to pay nearly $1 million to close roads during its New York City-based Five Boro Bike Tour; decision is setback for the city, which sought to have annual event classified as a non-charitable athletic parade.
lead_paragraph: The lawsuit, involving nearly $1 million, was the first to challenge New York City’s application of rules to defray costs of closing streets during athletic events.

headline.seo: Judge Says Bike Tour Doesn’t Have to Pay N.Y.C. for Road Closings
headline.main: Bike Tour Wins Lawsuit Over City Fees
headline.print_headline: Bike Tour Wins Lawsuit Over City Fees
